jobs.title: Community Manager (EMEA)
jobs.description:
Please note, only applications made via Typeform will be considered:
https://unboundglobal.typeform.com/to/Jzpnz4

The successful candidate for the position of Community Manager (EMEA) will report to the Head of Innovation & Startup Ecosystem and be based in London. The role positions an individual in a young, fast-growing team at one of the world’s largest innovation platforms. 

The Community Manager (EMEA) will lead the development of a network of engaged community partners around three key events, FinTech Abu Dhabi (October 2019), Technology Innovation Pioneers (Also known as TIP, November 2019) and Unbound London (TBC 2020). You will identify relevant networks and communities, connect with them and bring them on as active promoters of these events to drive up delegate interest in each event as well as drive applications to startup opportunities.

This will support the team’s overall accountability and responsibility for the delivery of innovation activity, including the identification, onboarding and monitoring of community partnerships for Unbound Festivals and Labs in Europe, the Middle East and North Africa while supporting startup scouting & the development of ecosystem intelligence. As Unbound is a global organisation, your duties will not be exclusive to the region in which you are based.

To review the complete job pack, please click below:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/eref13o2qbeieqd/Community%20Manager%20-%20Innovation%20%26%20Startup%20%28EMEA%29%20-%20Job%20Pack.pdf?dl=0

jobs.title: Startup Engagement Manager (EMEA)
jobs.description:
Please note, only applications made via Typeform will be considered: 
https://unboundglobal.typeform.com/to/hXkSdc

The successful candidate for the position of Startup Engagement Manager (EMEA) will report to the Head of Innovation & Startup Ecosystem and be based in London. The role positions an individual in a young, fast-growing team at one of the world’s largest innovation platforms. 

The Startup Engagement Manager (EMEA) will lead the scouting, review and onboarding of startups for Unbound’s events in Europe, Middle East and Africa (FinTech Abu Dhabi, October 2019; Technology Innovation Pioneers, November 2019; and Unbound London, TBC 2020). You will work with the Community Manager to connect with and onboard Community Partners, then work with those partners to engage relevant startups. You will drive the promotion of startup opportunities and support the operations team, based in Singapore, to onboard exhibitors to events. First and foremost, you will be the first point of contact for Startups involved in the FinTech 50 at FinTech Abu Dhabi, those invited to TIP and the Unbound50 at Unbound London.

You will support the team’s overall delivery of innovation activity, including the scouting, onboarding and monitoring of startups while supporting community partner engagement & the development of ecosystem intelligence. As Unbound is a global organisation, your duties will not be exclusive to the region in which you are based.

To review the complete job pack, please click below: 
https://www.dropbox.com/s/p54lbcgjrspto4g/Startup%20Engagement%20Manager%20-%20Innovation%20%26%20Startup%20%28EMEA%29%20-%20Job%20Pack.pdf?dl=0

jobs.title: Senior Content Manager (London)
jobs.description:
About Unbound Innovations

Founded by Daniel Seal in 2013, Unbound has quickly developed into an internationally recognised market-leading platform connecting grassroots innovation with corporates, brands and governments.

Headquartered in London and with an expanding network of offices in Singapore and the Middle East, Unbound is a dynamic company that is the foremost connector in the technology and innovation space. It prides itself on its talented, energetic team and has scaled rapidly into new markets, firmly positioning itself at the centre of the innovation ecosystem. The talented team has full capabilities to execute festivals, content creation and bespoke corporate innovation programmes.

Unbound Festivals are a global series of events that celebrate innovation. Over 35,000 founders, entrepreneurs, investors, brands, corporates, start-ups and influencers will attend the award-winning Unbound festivals in 2019. The flagship Asia event is held annually in Singapore (Innovfest Unbound), and is the largest innovation festival in South East Asia. In addition, Unbound takes place in London and Bahrain, and in 2019, the team will be running two innovation festivals in Abu Dhabi looking at FinTech, HealthTech, EnviroTech and Energy Technology.

Unbound Labs use the global network to connect brands and corporations with startups to help them solve the digital transformation challenges they face, and thus build for a digital future. Strategic partners include government agencies and leading global brands such as Unilever, Vodafone, Lloyds Banking Group, Salesforce, Oracle, HSBC, JLL, SingTel, Facebook and Amazon.

We are looking for a relentlessly hungry and ambitious content specialist, who will work on the London and Abu Dhabi events, creating world-class agendas, inviting and managing ground-breaking, awe-inspiring speakers and co-creating content for the portfolio. This person must be motivated to join a business that is rapidly expanding and want to contribute to that growth, taking Unbound to the next level.

The right candidate will be expected to:

- Manage all speaker curation and agenda building for the company’s global innovation events
- Book world-class speakers across multiple industries
- Be confident directing tech leaders on content
- Be relentless in the pursuit of great content
- Assist with market research and trend spotting
- Cultivate relationships with the most promising up-and-coming performers in a variety of industries
- Develop and deliver an overall strategy for our content offering and use across live events
- Work closely with the commercial team to identify key commercial topics and help with introductions to potential sponsor prospects
- Drive the expansion of content and building a network of contributors, including event speakers, editorial contributors and advisory panels
- Consistently deliver high-quality, high impact services to our stakeholders
- Identify new commercial opportunities through content analysis and working with the commercial teams to realise your visions.
- Assist with delegate relations and management
- Assist with on-site speaker management
- Copywriting and the creation of creative collateral
- Ability to understand both what content your audience needs to know and how they want to consume it.

Required Skills and Qualifications

- At least 3 years’ experience programming/producing content for print media, radio, television or events
- Understanding and interest in the technology and startup space
- Sociable and able to connect with people at all levels of an organisation, including up to the highest levels of government  
- Relatively autonomous, and good at multitasking as well as handling multiple high maintenance stakeholders
- Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma and experience in a similar role will be a bonus
- Deadline driven and well-organised with strong time-management skills
- Good at learning and growing from the experience 
- High level of proficiency in Outlook, Word, Powerpoint and Excel

How to Apply:

Applications should take the form of a letter (no more than one page of A4) providing evidence of how you meet the specifications, and your CV – both attached to an email and send to Helen Avins, helen.avins@unbound.live

Whilst we’d love to update all applicants on the status of their application, we are only able to inform successful candidates of their status due to the large number of applications we receive
